meanings.def: a building used for religious worship, especially in religions other than Christianity
examples: the Temple of Diana at Ephesus
(North American English) to go to temple (= to a service in a synagogue, where Jews worship)
They went to pray in the temple.
These deities prevent evil spirits from entering the temple precincts.

meanings.def: each of the flat parts at the sides of the head, at the same level as the eyes and higher
examples: He had black hair, greying at the temples.
There was a throbbing in her temples.

related: Knights of the Temple of Solomon
